- Donald Rumsfeld "goes so far as to depict former President Bush as presiding over a national security process that was marked by incoherent decision-making and policy drift, most damagingly on the war in Iraq."- Donald Rumsfeld remains largely unapologetic about his overall handling of the Iraq conflict and concludes that the war has been worth the costs. Had the government of Saddam Hussein remained in power, he says, the Middle East would be "far more perilous than it is today'.- "Addressing charges that he failed to provide enough troops for the war, he allows that,` In retrospect, there may have been times when more troops could have helped"."

Congressional Progressive Caucus sent a letter to Barack Obama last week requesting a meeting before Tuesday's address for the sole purpose of discussing Social Security. Sheldon Whitehouse and Sen. Bernie Sanders said they support a move such as eliminating the cap on the maximum taxable earnings as a way to close the cost gap of Social Security down the road. has a scheduled video teleconference to link U.S. and Asian school children, so they can freely exchange solar ideas and foster friendships. CBS News reports that Dodge-Chrysler is seriously rethinking minivans as an automotive form factor, and that the company plans to completely redesign the iconic American family hauler. We need to seriously rethink the minivan, said Sergio Marchionne , CEO of Chrysler, in a recent ABC interview. "We need to retain all its functionality but make it much more versatile.
